result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Marie Badciong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

PPf paid,  copy mailed to defendant.

re Counts 1, 2 and 4
re Count 3
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #1
Return of CHSO's DNA sample/testing form letter
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgment signed by defendant in court.

Defendant Lisa Marie Badciong in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Lawrence Jean Broeren appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls case and notes appearances.  Attorney Cohen states joint recommendation.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Filed.   Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.  Defendant informed of charges and penalties.  Factual basis and probable cause found.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Proposed information provided to the Court.  State requests amendment of charge. Court grants motion to amend charges. State to file Amended Information.

Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1-4 of the Amended Information.  Court accepts pleas as voluntarily and knowingly and intelligently made.   Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1-4 of the amended information.

Court orders:
As to Count 1 - sentence  of 9 months in jail commencing at 3:00 pm today.  With huber priviledges as agent and sheriff department believes appropriate
As to Count 2 -  sentence to 9 months consecutive to count 1.
As to Count 4 sentence to 9 months consecutive to count 1 and 2 

Court withholds sentence on felony charge
As to Count 3 probation for 5 years consecutive to counts 1,2, and 4.
Conditions of probation are to serve 1 year in jail, consecutive to other counts.  
Monitoring of free of intoxicants, agent to determine type of monitoring.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Not to drive w/o a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs, unless prescriped.
No drug paraphernalia.
150 hours of community service.
Court costs of $1,847.00
/ faxed to Jail and Probatio on 02/05/2018, #8105
02/09/2018:  AODA and DSP was not ordered by the court.  Defendant did not plead to an OWI.  AODA and DSP was entered in error.
